div.p: RECTITUDE in philoſophy, refers either to the act of judging or of willing ; and therefore whatever comes under the denomination of rectitude, is either what is true or what is good, theſe being the only objects about which the mind exerciſes its two faculties <ff judging and willing.

Moral rectitude, or 'uprightnefs, is the chooſing and purſuing thoſe things which the mind, upon due inqui-ry and attention, clearly perceives to be good ; and avoiding thoſe that are evil. See Moral Philoſophy.
